frameDefinitions: In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
This frame concerns  words that express an Object's position on a scale, its Measurement, with respect to some attribute, its Dimension.
This frame contains nouns denoting a rank or level within an established hierarchy.
An Entity has a particular scalar Attribute with a value exceeding a contextually-specified or generally-understood standard.
The size of an Entity is assessed in terms of the Degree by which it deviates from the norm.
This frame covers descriptions of an entire human body, viewed as a gestalt (as opposed to descriptions based on salient body parts).
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Dimension</fen> which is measured.  Most LUs in this frame incorporate the <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<fen>Object</fen> identifies the item which is measured along one of its <fen>Dimension</fen>s.
<fen>Measurement</fen> identifies the extent of the <fen>Object</fen> along the specified <fen>Dimension</fen>.
The Rank itself, usually denoted by the noun.
An entity which holds a particular <fen>Rank</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which a particular gradable <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Value</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Value</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The thing whose size is being considered.
The feature of an (actual or possible) <fen>Entity</fen> that is measured. In literal examples, it essentially must be size, or a word equivalent to size such as bulk.
This role identifies the individual (or individuals) being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
listRoleExamples: The  new vase is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
<fex>The  new vase</fex> is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
The  new vase is <fex>5 cm</fex> in circumference at the top.
The particles were smaller <fex>in size</fex> than expected .
